revised_title: On a Fourth State of Matter: Exploring the Properties of Radiant Matter
tldr: Crookes discusses the existence of a fourth state of matter, beyond gas, which he calls 'radiant matter.' This state occurs when molecules are rarefied to the point where their mean free path is comparable to the dimensions of the containing vessel, resulting in a loss of gaseous properties. He also speculates that matter is a mode of motion and that molecules, rather than the collective assemblage, are the true form of matter.
